intro: Chionanthus micranthus, commonly known as the Chinese fringeflower, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its showy, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, simple, and ovate leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. The Chinese fringeflower is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional Chinese medicine.
